result.execSummary:
The defendant Lewis Arnold Fleming was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for work and school. Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

miscConds.notes: No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. No illegally controlled substances; random screening.

Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.  Pay a fine of $100 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
Be in a job training program or seek and maintain employment.
Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lewis Arnold Fleming

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lewis Arnold Fleming in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction with Huber for work and school and 3 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay a fine of $100 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) no illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA,  treatment or program; 6) be in a job training program or seek and maintain employment.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant Lewis Arnold Fleming in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.    There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lewis Arnold Fleming in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Nathaniel E. Adamson for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lewis Arnold Fleming in court with attorney Matthew Lamke. Paul Hauer for  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lewis Arnold Fleming in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Defendant Lewis Arnold Fleming in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
